clinical_graph.title: Delirium in the ICU — practical pathway

nodes.text: Delirium in the ICU — assessment and management
Stabilize ABCs; address pain, hypoxia/hypercapnia, hypoglycemia; review vitals/ECG, meds, substance use.
Screen at least daily with CAM-ICU and/or ICDSC (score ≥4 = delirium). Document CAM-ICU/ICDSC frequency in orders
Delirium present by CAM-ICU or ICDSC ≥4?
Delirium confirmed.
No delirium now; continue prevention bundle and routine screening.

Identify and correct contributors: hypoxia; electrolyte/metabolic (Na, Mg, Ca, urea, glucose); thyroid; thiamine deficiency; hepatic encephalopathy; infection; withdrawal; anticholinergic/sedative meds.
Non-pharmacologic bundle: reorientation (clocks/calendars), family engagement, early mobility, glasses/hearing aids, sleep protocol (minimize nighttime disruptions), ABCDEF bundle.
Danger to self/staff or essential care blocked despite non-pharm?
Pharmacologic pathway (short course; lowest effective dose).
Continue non-pharm bundle and frequent reorientation; avoid routine sedatives.
Alcohol/benzodiazepine withdrawal suspected?
Use benzodiazepines per protocol for withdrawal; adjuncts as needed; monitor RASS and respiratory status.
Avoid routine benzodiazepines.
QTc ≥500 ms or high torsades risk / severe parkinsonism?
Prefer dexmedetomidine infusion (ventilated or monitored setting); watch bradycardia/hypotension.
Use antipsychotic: haloperidol short-term for severe agitation; quetiapine/other atypical for ongoing symptoms; monitor QTc.
Implement sleep-promoting protocol: cluster care, reduce nighttime noise/light, schedule procedures to allow uninterrupted sleep.
Use PRE-DELIRIC / E-PRE-DELIRIC for risk stratification; target modifiable risks (benzodiazepine exposure, deep sedation).
Improving with current plan?
Taper/stop pharmacologic agents; maintain non-pharm bundle; continue daily screening.
Re-search reversible causes; optimize non-pharm; adjust medication choice/dose; consider specialist input.
Delirium resolved or controlled; prevention maintained; follow-up and documentation complete.
